about.title: About the Livada Biotope
about.description: Learn about this wetlands meadow space and what we do.
about.content:
## What we're about

The Livada Biotope is a wetlands meadow that explores different ways of relating to our surroundings and other living beings. Through the BOB Institute, we work with art, science, and practical activities to create connections across different fields and ways of knowing.

## Our approach

We're interested in moving beyond human-centered thinking and learning from the environment around us. As temporary residents of this space, we're figuring out how to live alongside other species in ways that work for everyone.

projects.title: What we're working on
projects.subtitle: Current and past initiatives in the Livada Biotope.
projects.noProjects: No active projects at the moment.
projects.description: Explore the different projects happening in the Livada Biotope, with a focus on sustainable approaches and respect for all living beings.

events.title: Events
events.description: Throughout the year, various activities take place in the wetlands - from practical workshops and educational lectures to community gatherings and volunteer actions. Check out our calendar and join us!

hostEvent.title: Want to organize an event?
hostEvent.description: If you're interested in organizing a workshop, lecture, or community event in the wetlands, get in touch. We welcome all proposals that align with our mission of promoting biodiversity, ecological awareness, and respectful coexistence with nature.

events.noEvents: No upcoming events at the moment

common.pageDescription: A wetlands meadow space for sustainable living and permaculture in Ljubljana

biodiversity.title: Living world
biodiversity.description: Discover the variety of life in the Livada Biotope through community science and interspecies connections.

kinship.title: Interspecies Kinship
kinship.content1: At Livada Biotope, we embrace the concept of interspecies kinship – recognizing our deep connections with all living beings. We are not just observers of nature; we are active participants in a complex web of relationships that transcends species boundaries.
kinship.content2: Through our biodiversity monitoring initiatives, we invite you to develop meaningful relationships with the more-than-human world around us. This is not just about scientific observation – it's about nurturing connections, understanding interdependence, and developing ecological empathy.

observations.title: Recent Observations
observations.description: Explore the latest species observations in the wetlands, contributed by members of our citizen science community and nature enthusiasts.

citizenScience.title: Citizen Science
citizenScience.description: Join our community of citizen scientists and contribute to biodiversity data collection in the wetlands.
citizenScience.contribute: Contribute your observations and help monitor biodiversity in the wetlands.
citizenScience.getInvolved: Join us today and become part of our citizen science community!

speciesList.title: Species List
speciesList.description: View the list of species that have been recorded in the wetlands so far.

footer.description: A complex initiative for developing land-based practices in the wetlands and promoting sustainable ways of living.

ecofeminism.title: Ecofeminism
ecofeminism.description: Exploring the intersection of ecology and feminism in our work at The Livada Biotope.

intro.title: Ecofeminist Perspectives
intro.content: Our approach at The Livada Biotope is deeply rooted in ecofeminist principles. We believe in the interconnectedness of all life forms and challenge the patriarchal structures that have led to environmental destruction and social inequalities. Through our work, we aim to create spaces where diverse forms of knowledge and ways of being can flourish.
